com.owlike.genson

Interface Converter<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of objects handled by this converter.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Deserializer<T>, Serializer<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BeanDescriptor, BeanViewConverter, ClassMetadataConverter, DefaultConverters.ArrayConverter, DefaultConverters.ArrayDequeConverter, DefaultConverters.BigDecimalConverter, DefaultConverters.BigIntegerConverter, DefaultConverters.BooleanConverter, DefaultConverters.ByteArrayAsIntArrayConverter, DefaultConverters.ByteArrayConverter, DefaultConverters.CalendarConverter, DefaultConverters.CollectionConverter, DefaultConverters.ComplexMapConverter, DefaultConverters.DateConverter, DefaultConverters.DoubleConverter, DefaultConverters.EnumConverter, DefaultConverters.EnumSetConverter, DefaultConverters.FileConverter, DefaultConverters.FloatConverter, DefaultConverters.HashMapConverter, DefaultConverters.HashTableConverter, DefaultConverters.IntegerConverter, DefaultConverters.LinkedHashMapConverter, DefaultConverters.LinkedHashSetConverter, DefaultConverters.LinkedListConverter, DefaultConverters.LongConverter, DefaultConverters.MapConverter, DefaultConverters.NumberConverter, DefaultConverters.PrimitiveConverterFactory.booleanConverter, DefaultConverters.PrimitiveConverterFactory.doubleConverter, DefaultConverters.PrimitiveConverterFactory.intConverter, DefaultConverters.PrimitiveConverterFactory.longConverter, DefaultConverters.PriorityQueueConverter, DefaultConverters.PropertiesConverter, DefaultConverters.SetConverter, DefaultConverters.ShortConverter, DefaultConverters.StringConverter, DefaultConverters.TimestampConverter, DefaultConverters.TreeMapConverter, DefaultConverters.TreeSetConverter, DefaultConverters.URIConverter, DefaultConverters.URLConverter, DefaultConverters.UUIDConverter, JSR353Bundle.JsonValueConverter, NullConverter, NullConverter.NullConverterWrapper, OptionalConverter, RuntimeTypeConverter

    public interface Converter<T>
extends Serializer<T>, Deserializer<T>
    Converter interface is a shorthand for classes who want to implement both serialization and deserialization. You should always privilege Converter instead of low level Serializer and Deseriliazer as they will be wrapped into a converter and all the ChainedFactory mechanism is designed for converters. Here is an example of a Converter of URLs. 

     Genson genson = new Genson.Builder().with(new Converter<URL>() {

        @Override
        public void serialize(URL url, ObjectWriter writer, Context ctx) {
                // you don't have to worry about null objects, as the library will handle them.
                writer.writeValue(obj.toExternalForm());
  }

        @Override
        public URL deserialize(ObjectReader reader, Context ctx) {
                return new URL(reader.valueAsString());
  }

 }).create();

 String serializedUrl = genson.serialize(new URL("http://www.google.com"));
 URL url = genson.deserialize(serializedUrl, URL.class);

    As you can see it is quite straightforward to create and register new Converters. Here is an example dealing with more complex objects.

    Author:
    eugen
